title: Scenario-Based Microlearning for Leukocyte Structure and Function in Clinical Hematology

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic biology and medical terminology, familiarity with fundamental concepts of cytology
context.additional_context: A supplementary learning program for graduate students receiving theory-centered education without practical experience. Designed for smartphone-based learning in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the structure and function of the five major white blood cell types (neutrophils, eosinophils, basophils, monocytes, lymphocytes).
Learners can analyze the clinical significance of differential WBC count results.
Learners can apply appropriate diagnostic reasoning to patient cases suspected of white blood cell abnormalities through scenario-based problem-solving.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
